pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:5.1: 49. The training rule on sticking out the tongue
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate sticking out their tongues. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:7.2: “‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:8.1: One should not eat sticking out the tongue.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:10.1: The ninth training rule is finished.
